prime.bindable.RevertableBindable<T>

type
class
extends
Bindable<T>
available in
cpp, cs, java, js, neko, php, swf
metadata
:build
'???'
:keep
A Bindable that keeps a copy of its value when entering edit-mode: using beginEdit(), and reverts to it when editing is cancelled by calling cancelEdit(). The value change signalling and bindings to other Bindables are configurable through RevertableBindableFlags. The default behaviour is to: - dispatch all _valid_ changes through the change signal. - only dispatch/propagate _valid_ changes to other Bindables when: _not_ in, or leaving; edit-mode. The value can only change when in edit-mode (by calling beginEdit()), or directly through set(). When setting 'this.value' is tried while not in edit-mode, the new value is discarded. Additionally when compiled in debug-mode an assertion exception is thrown.

inherited from prime.bindable.Bindable
Dispatched just before "value" is set to a new value. Signal arguments: new-value, old-value

Keeps track of settings.

shadowValue(default,null) : T

The last valid value. Zero/null until this.value is changed while in editing mode.

beginEdit() : Void

overrides prime.bindable.Bindable
metadata
:keep
Puts this in editing-mode and keeps a copy of the current value if not already in edit-mode.

inline bind(otherBindable : IBindableReadonly<T>) : Void

inherited from prime.bindable.Bindable
Makes sure this.value is (and remains) equal to otherBindables value. In other words: - update this when otherBindable.value changes

cancelEdit() : Void

overrides prime.bindable.Bindable
Discards the new value and finishes edit-mode.

pair(otherBindable : IBindable<T>) : Void

inherited from prime.bindable.Bindable
Makes sure this Bindable and otherBindable always have the same value. In other words: - update this when otherBindable.value changes - update otherBindable when this.value changes
